      • createSmartPsiElementPointer

        public <E extends PsiElement> SmartPsiElementPointer<E> createSmartPsiElementPointer(E element)
        Description copied from class: SmartPointerManager
        Creates a smart pointer to the specified PSI element. If the element's containing file is known, it's more preferable to use SmartPointerManager.createSmartPsiElementPointer(PsiElement, PsiFile).
        Specified by:
        createSmartPsiElementPointer in class SmartPointerManager
        Parameters:
        element - the element to create a pointer to.
        Returns:
        the smart pointer instance.

      • createSmartPsiElementPointer

                                                                                     PsiFile containingFile)
        Description copied from class: SmartPointerManager
        Creates a smart pointer to the specified PSI element.
        Specified by:
        createSmartPsiElementPointer in class SmartPointerManager
        Parameters:
        element - the element to create a pointer to.
        containingFile - the result of element.getContainingFile().
        Returns:
        the smart pointer instance.

      • removePointer

        public void removePointer(SmartPsiElementPointer<?> pointer)
        Description copied from class: SmartPointerManager
        Disposes a smart pointer and frees the resources associated with it. Calling this method is not obligatory: pointers are freed correctly when they're not used anymore. But disposing the pointers explicitly might be beneficial for performance.
        Specified by:
        removePointer in class SmartPointerManager

      • getPointersNumber

        public int getPointersNumber(PsiFile containingFile)

      • pointToTheSameElement

        public boolean pointToTheSameElement(SmartPsiElementPointer<?> pointer1,
                                     SmartPsiElementPointer<?> pointer2)
        Description copied from class: SmartPointerManager
        This method is cheaper than dereferencing both pointers and comparing the result.
        Specified by:
        pointToTheSameElement in class SmartPointerManager
        Parameters:
        pointer1 - smart pointer to compare
        pointer2 - smart pointer to compare
        Returns:
        true if both pointers point to the same PSI element.
